  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Finance Manager",
  "description": "Aku is a fully-licensed payment led digital bank on a mission to disrupt cash and drive financial inclusion, one mobile device at a time. We have a passionate and dynamic team, that is committed to delivering excellence. As we expand, we are looking for individuals that share our vision &amp; values and are excited about being a part of a community that intentionally plays their individual/collective tole in building a self-sustaining timeless legacy.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Finance Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	The Senior Finance Manager will be responsible for safeguarding the company&rsquo;s financial integrity, optimizing profitability, and enabling sustainable growth.
	This role oversees the accuracy of all financial operations, including revenue recognition, cost attribution, and reconciliation of settlement accounts.
	The successful candidate will drive initiatives to prevent revenue leakage, strengthen internal controls, and ensure transparent tracking of financial flows across banking and partner platforms.
	As a key advisor to the Executive team, Product, Engineering, and Business Units, the Senior Finance Manager will provide commercially grounded insights to support data-driven decision-making, risk mitigation, and long-term financial planning.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Finance &amp; leadership:


	Serve as a strategic advisor to the executive team on financial planning, fundraising, business modeling, and risk management.
	Lead financial forecasting, budgeting, and scenario planning across all business units.
	Drive long-term financial strategy aligned with company objectives.


Finance Operations &amp; Compliance:


	Oversee all financial operations including accounting, treasury, tax, and internal controls.
	Ensure timely and accurate financial reporting and compliance with all statutory requirements.
	Ensure full compliance with local and international financial regulations (e.g., CBN, PCI-DSS, KYC/AML, etc.).
	Manage audit relationships, regulatory filings, and risk management processes.
	Optimize working capital, cash flow management, and cost efficiency.


Commercial &amp; Revenue Operations:


	Own revenue assurance across transaction processing, fee structures, and partner settlements.
	Collaborate with product and engineering teams to align revenue tracking with system architecture.


Team Leadership &amp; Development:


	Build and lead a high-performing finance team; mentor and develop in-house talent.
	Foster a culture of financial discipline and accountability across departments.


Stakeholder Management:


	Present clear financial insights and reporting to the board, investors, and external stakeholders.


Systems &amp; Process Improvements:


	Implement scalable systems, tools, and processes to support growth and ensure operational efficiency.
	Leverage data to build dashboards, automate reporting, and improve financial visibility.


Qualifications and Skills
Education:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, Accounting, or related field.
	MBA or relevant professional certifications (e.g., CPA, CFA, CISA, CFE) is a plus.


Experience:


	7+ years of progressive finance leadership experience, preferably in high-growth environments, fintech, banking or payment services.
	Proven experience leading budgeting, financial planning, and fundraising efforts.
	Deep knowledge of accounting principles, financial reporting, tax regulations, and compliance frameworks.
	Strong understanding of business metrics, unit economics, and SaaS / tech / product / retail finance


Skills:


	Strong analytical and financial modeling skills.
	Excellent negotiation and stakeholder management capabilities.
	Deep knowledge of payment infrastructure, transaction processing, and bank integration.
	Proficiency with finance tools and reconciliation systems.
	Comfortable working across cross-functional teams in high-growth and evolving environments.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their updated CVs to:&nbsp;recrutiment@aku.africa&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of their email.

        Aku is a fully-licensed payment led digital bank on a mission to disrupt cash and drive financial inclusion, one mobile device at a time. We have a passionate and dynamic team, that is committed to delivering excellence. As we expand, we are looking for individuals that share our vision & values and are excited about being a part of a community that intentionally plays their individual/collective tole in building a self-sustaining timeless legacy.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Finance Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	The Senior Finance Manager will be responsible for safeguarding the company’s financial integrity, optimizing profitability, and enabling sustainable growth.
	This role oversees the accuracy of all financial operations, including revenue recognition, cost attribution, and reconciliation of settlement accounts.
	The successful candidate will drive initiatives to prevent revenue leakage, strengthen internal controls, and ensure transparent tracking of financial flows across banking and partner platforms.
	As a key advisor to the Executive team, Product, Engineering, and Business Units, the Senior Finance Manager will provide commercially grounded insights to support data-driven decision-making, risk mitigation, and long-term financial planning.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Finance & leadership:


	Serve as a strategic advisor to the executive team on financial planning, fundraising, business modeling, and risk management.
	Lead financial forecasting, budgeting, and scenario planning across all business units.
	Drive long-term financial strategy aligned with company objectives.


Finance Operations & Compliance:


	Oversee all financial operations including accounting, treasury, tax, and internal controls.
	Ensure timely and accurate financial reporting and compliance with all statutory requirements.
	Ensure full compliance with local and international financial regulations (e.g., CBN, PCI-DSS, KYC/AML, etc.).
	Manage audit relationships, regulatory filings, and risk management processes.
	Optimize working capital, cash flow management, and cost efficiency.


Commercial & Revenue Operations:


	Own revenue assurance across transaction processing, fee structures, and partner settlements.
	Collaborate with product and engineering teams to align revenue tracking with system architecture.


Team Leadership & Development:


	Build and lead a high-performing finance team; mentor and develop in-house talent.
	Foster a culture of financial discipline and accountability across departments.


Stakeholder Management:


	Present clear financial insights and reporting to the board, investors, and external stakeholders.


Systems & Process Improvements:


	Implement scalable systems, tools, and processes to support growth and ensure operational efficiency.
	Leverage data to build dashboards, automate reporting, and improve financial visibility.


Qualifications and Skills
Education:


	Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, Accounting, or related field.
	MBA or relevant professional certifications (e.g., CPA, CFA, CISA, CFE) is a plus.


Experience:


	7+ years of progressive finance leadership experience, preferably in high-growth environments, fintech, banking or payment services.
	Proven experience leading budgeting, financial planning, and fundraising efforts.
	Deep knowledge of accounting principles, financial reporting, tax regulations, and compliance frameworks.
	Strong understanding of business metrics, unit economics, and SaaS / tech / product / retail finance


Skills:


	Strong analytical and financial modeling skills.
	Excellent negotiation and stakeholder management capabilities.
	Deep knowledge of payment infrastructure, transaction processing, and bank integration.
	Proficiency with finance tools and reconciliation systems.
	Comfortable working across cross-functional teams in high-growth and evolving environments.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their updated CVs to: recrutiment@aku.africa using the Job Position as the subject of their email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further steps in the recruitment process.

title: Job Openings at Ajoke Group
content:
Ajoke Group, a distributor of major FMCG in Nigeria, is recruiting to fill the following positions below:

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Accountant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage all accounting transactions
	Prepare budget forecasts
	Publish financial statements in time
	Handle monthly, quarterly and annual closings
	Reconcile accounts payable and receivable
	Ensure timely bank payments
	Compute taxes and prepare tax returns
	Manage balance sheets and profit/loss statements
	Report on the company’s financial health and liquidity
	Audit financial transactions and documents
	Reinforce financial data confidentiality and conduct database backups when necessary
	Comply with financial policies and regulations


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor's Degree with 2 - 3 years of work experience. 


Application Closing Date: 25th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.asl@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Van Sales Representative

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Drive a company-owned van to assigned territories, routes, or customer locations to conduct sales visits and deliveries.
	Load and unload products from the van, ensuring accurate inventory counts and proper handling of goods.
	Establish and maintain relationships with existing and potential customers, addressing their needs and preferences to drive sales.
	Present and demonstrate products or services to customers, highlighting features, benefits, and pricing information.
	Take orders from customers, process sales transactions, and issue receipts or invoices for purchases.
	Negotiate pricing, discounts, and terms with customers to maximize sales revenue and profitability.
	Cross-sell or upsell additional products or services to customers to increase order value and meet sales targets.
	Provide product recommendations, advice, and assistance to customers based on their requirements and preferences.
	Maintain accurate records of sales activities, customer interactions, and inventory levels using sales software or databases.
	Monitor competitor activities, market trends, and customer feedback to identify opportunities and challenges in the sales territory.
	Collaborate with sales managers, supervisors, and colleagues to coordinate sales activities, share insights, and develop strategies.
	Participate in sales meetings, training sessions, and product knowledge sessions to stay updated on company offerings and sales techniques.
	Resolve customer complaints, issues, or concerns in a timely and professional manner, ensuring customer satisfaction and retention.
	Follow safety protocols and driving regulations while operating the company van, ensuring safe transportation of products and personnel.
	Uphold company policies, procedures, and ethical standards in all sales and customer interactions.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with experience.


Application Closing Date: 22nd August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.asl@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Sales Representative

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Identify and target potential customers through various methods, including leads, referrals, and research.
	Initiate contact with prospective customers, present products or services, and build and maintain strong customer relationships.
	Deliver persuasive sales presentations and product demonstrations to showcase value propositions and benefits.
	Meet or exceed sales targets and quotas set by the company.
	Maintain in-depth knowledge of the company's products or services and stay informed about industry trends.
	Achieve and maintain sales quotas to drive revenue growth.
	Understand customer needs, challenges, and preferences, and provide tailored solutions to address specific requirements.
	Conduct market research to understand customer preferences, competitor activities, and market trends.
	Generate and maintain accurate sales reports, forecasts, and pipeline management.
	Provide post-sale support and follow-up to ensure customer satisfaction and address any issues or concerns.
	Identify opportunities to cross-sell or upsell additional products or services to existing customers.
	Gather feedback from customers to inform product/service improvements and enhance the overall customer experience.
	Follow established sales processes and CRM systems for effective sales management.
	Explore new markets, territories, or customer segments for potential business growth.
	Stay up-to-date with product or service knowledge and participate in training programs to remain informed and skilled in presenting and selling products or services.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / HND / Bachelor's Degree with 1 - 2 years of work experience.
